automation.description:
Deprecated. Use the "McAfe ePO v2 integration command epo-find-system" instead.

Return system info
automation.name: EPOFindSystem

commands.description: Displays help (information) for ePO commands. If no command argument is specified, returns all ePO commands.
commands.name: epo-help

commands.description: Checks the latest available DAT file version in the public McAfee repository.
commands.name: epo-get-latest-dat

commands.description: Checks the existing DAT file version in the ePO repository.
commands.name: epo-get-current-dat

commands.description: Executes the ePO command. Receives the mandatory 'command' argument, and other optional arguments. Run the 'epo-help' command to get a list of available commands. You can control the response format to be text instead of the default JSON format using resp_type=text. You can also specify the 'headers' argument to filter table headers. Example/:/ !epo-command command=system.find searchText=10.0.0.1 headers=EPOBranchNode.AutoID,EPOComputerProperties.ComputerName
commands.name: epo-command

commands.description: Runs a client task to update the DAT file on the given endpoints.
commands.name: epo-update-client-dat

commands.description: Triggers a server task in specific ePO servers to retrieve the latest signatures from the updated server.
commands.name: epo-update-repository

commands.description: Returns a system tree group.
commands.name: epo-get-system-tree-group

commands.description: Finds computers within a specified group in the McAfee ePO system tree.
commands.name: epo-find-systems

commands.description: Finds systems in the McAfee ePO system tree.
commands.name: epo-find-system

commands.description: Wakes up an agent.
commands.name: epo-wakeup-agent

commands.description: Applies a tag to the specified host names.
commands.name: epo-apply-tag

commands.description: Clears a tag from the specified host names.
commands.name: epo-clear-tag

commands.description: List tags that contain the searchText. If no searchText is specified, list all tags available in the ePO system.
commands.name: epo-list-tag

commands.description: Returns the ePO table of the table argument that is specified. If no table argument is specified, returns all ePO tables.
commands.name: epo-get-tables

commands.description: Queries an ePO table.
commands.name: epo-query-table

commands.description: Returns the ePO version.
commands.name: epo-get-version

commands.description: Moves a system to a different group in the McAfee ePO.
commands.name: epo-move-system

commands.description: Executes the ePO command. Run the 'epo-help' command to get a list of available commands. For example/:/  !epo-advanced-command command=clienttask.find commandArgs=searchText:On-Demand. You can also specify the 'headers' argument to filter table headers, for example/:/ !epo-command command=system.find searchText=10.0.0.1 headers=EPOBranchNode.AutoID,EPOComputerProperties.ComputerName.
commands.name: epo-advanced-command

commands.description: Finds client tasks.
commands.name: epo-find-client-task

commands.description: Finds policy.
commands.name: epo-find-policy

commands.description: Assigns a policy to the specified group or resets the group's inheritance for the specified policy
commands.name: epo-assign-policy-to-group

commands.description: Assigns a policy to a supplied list of systems or resets the systems' inheritance for the specified policy.
commands.name: epo-assign-policy-to-system

commands.description: List the issue for the ID that is specified. If no ID is specified, list all issues in the McAfee ePO system.
commands.name: epo-list-issues

commands.description: Delete an issue.
commands.name: epo-delete-issue

commands.description: Create an issue.
commands.name: epo-create-issue

commands.description: Update an issue.
commands.name: epo-update-issue

commands.description: Prints help (information) for ePO commands. If no command argument is specified, returns all ePO commands.
commands.name: epo-help

commands.description: Checks the latest DAT file in the McAfee repository.
commands.name: epo-get-latest-dat

commands.description: Checks the existing DAT file version in ePO.
commands.name: epo-get-current-dat

commands.description: Runs a client task to update the DAT file.
commands.name: epo-update-client-dat

commands.description: Triggers a server task in specific ePO servers to retrieve the latest signatures from the update server.
commands.name: epo-update-repository

commands.description: Returns system tree groups.
commands.name: epo-get-system-tree-group

commands.description: Finds computers within a specified group in the ePO tree.
commands.name: epo-find-systems

commands.description: Executes the ePO command. Receives the mandatory ''command'' argument, and other optional arguments. Run the ''epo-help'' command to get a list of available commands. You can also specify the ''headers'' argument to filter table headers. Example/:/ !epo-command command=system.find searchText=10.0.0.1 headers=EPOBranchNode.AutoID,EPOComputerProperties.ComputerName
commands.name: epo-command

commands.description: Executes the ePO command. Run the ''epo-help'' command to get a list of available commands. For example/:/  !epo-advanced-command command=clienttask.find commandArgs=searchText:On-demand. You can also specify the ''headers'' argument to filter table headers, for example/:/ !epo-command command=system.find searchText=10.0.0.1 headers=EPOBranchNode.AutoID,EPOComputerProperties.ComputerName.
commands.name: epo-advanced-command

commands.description: Wakes up an agent.
commands.name: epo-wakeup-agent

commands.description: Applies a tag to hostnames.
commands.name: epo-apply-tag

commands.description: Clears a tag from hostnames.
commands.name: epo-clear-tag

commands.description: Queries an ePO table.
commands.name: epo-query-table

commands.description: Returns an ePO table.
commands.name: epo-get-tables

commands.description: Finds systems in the system tree.
commands.name: epo-find-system

commands.description: Gets the ePO version. This requires global admin permissions.
commands.name: epo-get-version

commands.description: Moves a system to a different group.
commands.name: epo-move-system

integration.description: Deprecated. Use McAfee ePO v2 instead.
integration.name: McAfee ePO (Deprecated)

playbook.description: Perform a check on ePO endpoints to see if any endpoints are unmanaged or lost connectivity with ePO and take steps to return to a valid state.
playbook.name: McAfee ePO Endpoint Connectivity Diagnostics Playbook v2

playbook.description: Discover endpoints that are not using the latest McAfee AV signatures.
playbook.name: McAfee ePO Endpoint Compliance Playbook v2

playbook.description: Ensures that ePO servers are updated to the latest McAfee published AV signatures (DAT file version).
playbook.name: McAfee ePO Repository Compliance Playbook v2
